WorkItem.Description:
I bound SelectedDate to a dependency property on an object. Setting the object's property set the SelectedDate if no date was already set. Once set though, no changes to the property were detected by the DatePicker. Also, the object's property was never updated by changes in the DatePicker.
Â 
Attached is a simple WPF form demonstrating the problem. The Start property is bound to both a DatePicker and a TextBlock. There are two buttons to change the object's property. The DatePicker does not update correctly. The TextBlock does. Changing the DatePicker should cause the property to change, in turn causing the TextBlock to change.

Comments.Message: I have written a post where I suggest that this bug _could_ be related to a WPF Bindings feature: http://migueljuarez.awardspace.com/blog/?p=15
For me the binding works after I set the binding mode: Mode=TwoWay
Will the DatePicker be changed so the default Mode works like TwoWay?
Yes, the next release will include an update for DatePicker so that the default mode is TwoWay.

This bug has been fixed in our current builds and we will release an updated with this fix in the near future.

Thanks,
Samantha
